meanings.definition: To provide or serve as evidence of
meanings.sent1: She attested her skills by completing the task successfully.
meanings.sent2: The signature on the document attested to its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The cat attested its hunting prowess by catching a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers attested to the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The bright smile on her face attested to her happiness.

meanings.definition: To affirm to be true or genuine
meanings.sent1: He attested his innocence in front of the judge.
meanings.sent2: The witness attested that he saw the crime take place.
meanings.sent3: The child attested that the monster under the bed was real.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph attested to the family's history.
meanings.sent5: The shining diamond attested to its authenticity.
